Yes, I got the same problem......
Looks like crossedeyes (wide Right|Left) format, not standard SBS (Full Left|Right). MPC can stretch from wide to full, but it can't replace L/R. Is there a player (like youtube player) to do that?
...I found Stereoscopic Player to do that, I'm using 1.7.1 found on btjunkie, but it don't do subtitles. Still looking.
This is Over/Under(O/U) rather than Side-by-Side(SBS) Try to play this in your tv setting in O/U 3d settings it will play right

It's 3D, it's was just encoded for Right/Left SBS viewing instead of the default for most TVs which is Left/Right SBS. If you have option to switch to Right/Left on your TV then do it and you'll see it's fine. Although the 3D isn't that highly defined as it is in say Avatar or Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows 2
